So I went to the Medicare
program and said,

2702.33.text:
could we use Medicare data to
figure

2706.07.text:
And much to my delight

2710.77.text:

2712.43.text:
much to my delight, folks
at Medicare stepped

2715.73.text:
up and said, we'd be excited

2720.80.text:
Fast forward to last May
when we did a drill

2723.07.text:
in New Orleans, where we went
to New Orleans

2724.97.text:
and we pretended there was a
hurricane, and we sent CMS

2728.23.text:
zip codes of theoretically
effected areas,

2733.53.text:
and within a couple of hours,

2738.17.text:
HIPAA-compliant website
for the state health

2741.40.text:
department -- I mean,
for the local health

2743.03.text:
department, to say here
are all the people

2745.00.text:
who have oxygen concentrators
and ventilators.

2747.33.text:
And a bunch of us went
out, and we knocked

2750.70.text:
did we have the right people,
and did they have

2752.37.text:
the right equipment, and I can't
tell you how many times

2755.20.text:
I talked to people, who not
only said thank you

2757.33.text:
for knocking on my door, but
when I said,

2759.47.text:
so your oxygen concentrator,
does it have a battery?

2763.57.text:
And they just kind of
looked at me,

2764.63.text:
and they said, I don't know, it
plugs into the wall.

2767.53.text:
So we have a big
preparedness challenge

2769.43.text:
in helping people get ready,
but 93 percent

2772.57.text:
of the time we had their right
equipment, and their right

2774.73.text:
people, so I think we've
been able to really start

2778.40.text:
to liberate government
data for these purposes.

2781.97.text:
Now, with CMS we're in the
process of building

2784.17.text:
an interactive website, at a
zip code level,

2787.63.text:
that will not have personally
identifiable information,

2790.53.text:
but will tell somebody
who is running emergency

2793.43.text:
management or planning,
or public health

2795.27.text:
in a community, how many people
are electrically-dependent

2799.40.text:
Because I don't want to
hear another person

2801.43.text:
say to me, gosh, you know, all
the power was out,

2803.93.text:
and all these people came out
of the woodwork,

2805.47.text:
and we didn't know they lived
in our community.

2809.27.text:
So, part one, liberating
government data

2816.17.text:
Two weeks ago, whenever it

2826.63.text:

2830.50.text:

2833.37.text: of people in these zip codes.

And then it took a bit of

2840.77.text:
because that's what they wanted,
so that they could

2844.60.text:
But we have made

2853.83.text:
on somebody's piece of

2860.47.text:
the remaining battery life, to a

2869.67.text:

2871.93.text:

So on that end, we've been

2900.47.text:
for voluntary compliance,

we hosted an ideation challenge

We obviously need lots of

2958.20.text:
And obviously, we need

I've got a couple other

In every disaster we see

2981.53.text:

I'll also note that in

2997.63.text:

because so many people

3001.27.text:
are looking for friends and

3003.77.text:

3008.03.text:

3020.57.text:

Getting it from that

And so that's the other
